Pre-Game Insights: England and Greece are set to face each other in a highly anticipated Nations League encounter at Wembley, marking their first meeting in 18 years.
Both sides have secured victories over Ireland and Finland in their opening matches, with Greece edging out England on goal difference.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England has a historical dominance over Greece, remaining undefeated in nine previous encounters.
The most memorable match between these nations dates back 23 years to David Beckham’s iconic last-minute free kick that sealed England’s spot in the 2002 World Cup.
Others: The game will be broadcast live in the UK on ITV1, with live streaming available via the ITVX app.
Captain Harry Kane is set to lead the line after overcoming an injury scare, while injuries have forced Ezri Konsa, Kobbie Mainoo, and Morgan Gibbs-White to withdraw from the squad.
Greece, meanwhile, have a full-strength squad, with West Ham’s Dinos Mavropanos and Liverpool’s Kostas Tsimikas likely to start.
